metadata.name: Remote PowerShell Session Host Process (WinRM)
metadata.comment: Detects remote PowerShell sections by monitoring for wsmprovhost (WinRM host process) as a parent or child process (sign of an active PowerShell remote session).

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (activity_id = 1 AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\\\wsmprovhost.exe')) AND endswith(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('\\\\wsmprovhost.exe')))

output.summary: Detects remote PowerShell sections by monitoring for wsmprovhost (WinRM host process) as a parent or child process (sign of an active PowerShell remote session).

metadata.objective: Examine fields: ComputerName, actor.user.name, process.cmd_line False positive: Legitimate usage of remote Powershell, e.g. for monitoring purposes. Reference: https://threathunterplaybook.com/hunts/windows/190511-RemotePwshExecution/notebook.html
